translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Threes
I gave him a kaḷamba fruit,
and I was satisfied with my hands.
I do not recall a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the kaḷamba.
How welcome it was for me
…🔽I have done what had to be done.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kaḷambadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā kaḷambadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what had to be done.”🔽Thus the elder Kaḷambadāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Kaḷambadāyaka’s Birth Story, the sixth.
